title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox reportedly discussing trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder, amid ongoing trade talks.
Boston also considering trades involving starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval for infield reinforcements.
Potential infield targets include Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots LB K'Lavon Chaisson had a career year and wants to re-sign with New England in free agency.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks and 18 quarterback hits in the regular season, becoming a standout on the Patriots' defense.
Chaisson credits coordinators Josh McDaniels and Zak Kuhr for their roles in his success and team's Super Bowl appearance.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after being diagnosed with prostate cancer in September.
Williams underwent five rounds of chemotherapy at Mass General Hospital, responding well to treatment over four months.
Williams will join the Patriots for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, marking his first travel with the team this season.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council endorses Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city to support this global initiative.
The treaty aims to complement the Paris Agreement by promoting plant-based diets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve health.
Local advocates highlight plant-based diets' environmental and health benefits, encouraging Cambridge to improve access to plant-based foods.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, who died at 71, was known for roles in 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone'.
'Schitt's Creek', starring O'Hara as Moira Rose, is streaming on Hulu and Prime Video.
O'Hara's film 'A Mighty Wind' is available to stream free with ads on YouTube.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses superstition about Patriots' white uniforms, considers the choice unimportant for Super Bowl LX.
Patriots hold a 5-0 record wearing white uniforms this season; Seattle's 6-0 wearing navy blue outfits.
Teams wearing white jerseys have a 37-22 record in Super Bowls, with 16 wins in last 21 postseason games.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and the Islands expected to see 2-5 inches of snow; isolated 6-inch amounts possible for Nantucket.
Snowfall of 1-3 inches anticipated from South Shore to South County, Rhode Island; minimal effect for Boston and west of I-495.
Potential for minor coastal flooding along Eastern Massachusetts due to strong winds and a 1-3 foot storm surge.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics are unlikely to make major trades before the February 5 NBA trade deadline, according to ESPN.
Anfernee Simons, earning $27.7 million this season, is the most likely player for salary match in potential trades.
Celtics might focus on adding frontcourt depth, with interest in centers like Ivica Zubac despite limited salary flexibility.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston Licensing Board approved five restaurants to upgrade from beer-and-wine to all-alcohol licenses.
The approved restaurants are 89 Charles, Bebop, Carmelina’s, New England Wicked Craft Company, and Serafina.
New legislation in the 2026 Massachusetts State Budget facilitated the license upgrade process.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: NOAA confirmed the death of a 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale off North Carolina due to entanglement in fishing gear.
The whale, named 'Division', had been entangled in fishing gear multiple times and was last seen entangled on December 3, 2025.
This marks the first North Atlantic right whale fatality reported since May 2024, emphasizing the ongoing threat from human activities.
